alert.note: Alert for Arches, Grand Flat; Canyonlands, Natural Bridges; La Sal and Abajo Mountains; Southeast Utah (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 19 at 10:49PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: .An anomalous plume of moisture will move into the forecast area on Tuesday and last until early Friday. Additionally, a system moving through the Pacific Northwest and Northern Rockies will aid in the development of widespread showers and thunderstorms. These storms will be capable of producing heavy rainfall and cell training could lead to flash flooding. Long periods of light to moderate rain could also cause flooding issues. Event rainfall totals could exceed 1 to 3 inches along I-70 and points south, and 0.25 to 1 inches up north. Steep terrain, burn scars and slot canyons will be the most susceptible to flooding issues. Burn scars included in the Watch area include the Grizzly Creek Fire as well as the Pack Creek and Pine Gulch Fires and other smaller burn scars. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Colorado and Utah, including the following areas, in Colorado, Animas River Basin, Central Gunnison and Uncompahgre River Basin, Four Corners/Upper Dolores River, Grand Valley, Grand and Battlement Mesas, Northwest San Juan Mountains, Paradox Valley/Lower Dolores River, San Juan River Basin, Southwest San Juan Mountains and Uncompahgre Plateau and Dallas Divide. In Utah, Arches/Grand Flat, Canyonlands/Natural Bridges, La Sal and Abajo Mountains and Southeast Utah. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Arches, Grand Flat; Canyonlands, Natural Bridges; La Sal and Abajo Mountains; Southeast Utah
